Package Network.Queries

Class QueryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • Network.Queries.QueryClient

  • public class QueryClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the client side for sending queries over the network to a QueryServer. Created by ohlbach on 01.04.2016.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean error
      indicates errors during processing of a query

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      QueryClient​(java.net.InetAddress serverAddress, int serverPort)
      constructs a new client.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Object sendQuery​(Query query)
      sends a query to the server.
      void stop​()
      closes the connection to the server.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • error

        public boolean error
        indicates errors during processing of a query

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryClient

        public QueryClient​(java.net.InetAddress serverAddress,
                   int serverPort)
            throws java.io.IOException
        constructs a new client. One can send several queries via the same client.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - the server's address.
        serverPort - the server's port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the communication fails.

    • Method Detail

      • sendQuery

        public java.lang.Object sendQuery​(Query query)
        sends a query to the server. All errors are recorded in the messangers. In addition the error flag is set if an error occurred.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to be sent
        Returns:
        the answer, either an object, or a stream.

      • stop

        public void stop​()
        closes the connection to the server.
